posts.post_content:
Well, Goatllama, if we're going for massive typeline, why don't we keep going?   
  
Use [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) and his own -1 ability to turn him into an Artifact Creature Planeswalker, alright, cool.  
  
*Now* play [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening) and turn him into an Artifact Creature Enchantment Planeswalker. Not enough? Alright, equip Tezzeret with [Runed Stalactite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runed Stalactite) and then play [Life and Limb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life and Limb). Hell, let's go even more out there!  
  
Play [Rimefeather Owl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rimefeather Owl) and then use its ability to put an ice counter on it, giving it the snow subtype!  
  
Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas  
  
Snow Artifact Creature Enchantment Land Planeswalker - Forest Tezzeret  
  
(( In addition to being all creature types. ))  
  
You, proud sir, are now in ownership of the greatest card known to Magicdom. Even Storm Crow weeps at it's awesome typeline.
posts.html:
Well, Goatllama, if we're going for massive typeline, why don't we keep going?

Use Liquimetal Coating and his own -1 ability to turn him into an Artifact Creature Planeswalker, alright, cool.

Now play Enchanted Evening and turn him into an Artifact Creature Enchantment Planeswalker. Not enough? Alright, equip Tezzeret with Runed Stalactite and then play Life and Limb. Hell, let's go even more out there!

Play Rimefeather Owl and then use its ability to put an ice counter on it, giving it the snow subtype!

Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas

Snow Artifact Creature Enchantment Land Planeswalker - Forest Tezzeret

(( In addition to being all creature types. ))

You, proud sir, are now in ownership of the greatest card known to Magicdom. Even Storm Crow weeps at it's awesome typeline.

posts.post_content: Hold on a second. Tezzeret here can make your artifacts into 5/5 creatures. [Sarkhan the Mad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sarkhan the Mad) can turn creatures of yours into 5/5 dragons with flying. Tezzeret is UB, Sarkhan is RB, and [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker) is UBR. I think there's a very weird deck idea here. Slow and ineffective, yes, but it'd be Nicol Bolas and his major underlings. Tezzeret and Sarkhan make your stuff into nice 5/5 bodies, then Nicol Bolas eventually comes out and wrecks shop. This will never work, but I have to try it.

posts.post_content:
Interestingly, that second ability is one of the set's best answers to [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus), if you also have some infect you can block with.  
  
The first ability is basically an [Ancient Stirrings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Stirrings) that can't fetch land (unless you're playing with colored artifacts from older sets) but still seems like a pretty decent combo enabler.

posts.post_content: If you know that the other player has Bolt, then no, this guy can't be Bolted immediately. Once he enters play, you gain priority. You can use his +1 immediately, and the cost of adding a loyalty counter is paid before your opponent can do anything. This only works if you do it right as he enters play, before passing priority, but it still means that this guy won't just take a Bolt and die.
posts.html:
If you know that the other player has Bolt, then no, this guy can't be Bolted immediately. Once he enters play, you gain priority. You can use his +1 immediately, and the cost of adding a loyalty counter is paid before your opponent can do anything. This only works if you do it right as he enters play, before passing priority, but it still means that this guy won't just take a Bolt and die.

posts.post_content:
When Tezz was standard, I'd ramp him out with either [Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal) or [Sphere of the Suns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphere of the Suns) on turn 3, and then use his -1 on either a [Vault Skirge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault Skirge) or [Signal Pest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Signal Pest). He acted as a pseudo 5/5 haste (and sometimes lifelink) for my deck, which won a lot of races. When Tezz didn't show up, my [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator)s did, so I always had something to slap an [Inquisitor's Flail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitor's Flail) on (with a surprise [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike) for extra style points)!  
  
In modern format, I probably wouldn't try such an all-in approach unless my counter-control measures would actually hold up in that meta.  
  
EDIT: With the changes recently announced about the Legendary rule and Planeswalker uniqueness rule, Tezzeret will gain substantial support both in the way he and [Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal) function. Basically, Mox Opals beyond the first will behave like [Lotus Petal/autocard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal/autocard)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
When Tezz was standard, I'd ramp him out with either Mox Opal or Sphere of the Suns on turn 3, and then use his -1 on either a Vault Skirge or Signal Pest. He acted as a pseudo 5/5 haste (and sometimes lifelink) for my deck, which won a lot of races. When Tezz didn't show up, my Phyrexian Obliterators did, so I always had something to slap an Inquisitor's Flail on (with a surprise Tainted Strike for extra style points)!

In modern format, I probably wouldn't try such an all-in approach unless my counter-control measures would actually hold up in that meta.

posts.post_content:
I think MagicCritic's a troll. Calling Artifact decks terrible in all formats whilst using the no-longer-standard Lightning Bolt as an example of why he sucks should've been a given really. That, and Tezzy's not in standard either...  
  
Man, some Planeswalkers though! This guy's like [Elspeth Tirel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elspeth Tirel), he only needs one turn and then it's game. Any halfway decent artifact deck without some unusual theme going on will easily have enough to wipe you from the face of the earth.  
  
You can do a lot in that one turn though. This is why keeping a spell back for emergencies is always necessary.
posts.html:

Man, some Planeswalkers though! This guy's like Elspeth Tirel, he only needs one turn and then it's game. Any halfway decent artifact deck without some unusual theme going on will easily have enough to wipe you from the face of the earth.

You can do a lot in that one turn though. This is why keeping a spell back for emergencies is always necessary.
